interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Archer
Review Date: 2015/09/17
Categories: Comedy, Animation, Action
Product Description: ['Archer is an animated, half-hour comedy that revolves around an international spy agency and its employees. Although their work is daunting, every covert operation and global crisis are occasions for the staff to undermine, sabotage and betray each other for personal gains, pleasures and prosperity. An FX Networks Original Series.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bryan Fordney', 'Mack Williams', 'Matt Thompson', 'Casey Willis', 'Pierre Cerrato', 'Justin Wagner', 'Chi Duong', 'Megan Johnson', 'Chad Hurd', 'Marcus Rosentrater'], 'Producers': ['Fox']}
Review Text: Changing the entire premise of Archer for season 5 was IMHO an unfunny terrible ideal. I found very little to laugh at and a lot of the setups seemed lame and stretched out way too long.
Review Title: Why?
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Takers [Blu-ray] Paul Walker (Actor), Hayden Christensen (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ['This high-stakes action thriller stars Matt Dillon, Paul Walker, Idris Elba, Jay Hernandez, Michael Ealy and Tip “T.I.” Harris. After pulling off a spectacular series of brilliantly planned bank robberies, a notorious team of professional criminals attempts one last heist, a once-in-a-lifetime job with a $25 million payoff. And all that stands in their way is a cop hell-bent on doing whatever it takes to solve the case and bring the', 'Takers', 'down. Chris Brown and Hayden Christensen costar in an adrenaline-rushed thrill ride packed with twists and turns.'] {'Genre': 'Action, Drama', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '15423113', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 18, 2011', 'Actors': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} The only true robbery is by anyone buying this movie. It had been a long time since I've seen an action movie with such a combination of bad acting, horrible directing, a snoozer for a script and a cast that couldn't deliver their lines with any sort of skills. Rappers, C-list movie stars and singers make up this woeful cast of 'professional' bank robbers who only 'take' the big ones... the major chase scenes are so ridiculous you will roll your eyes and shake your head as you watch them.... there was a host of reasons a sequel wasn't made. Ugh.... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adam Arkin', 'Jon Avnet', 'Peter Werner', 'Michael Dinner', 'John Dahl', 'Bill Johnson', 'Michael W. Watkins', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Don Kurt', 'Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Timberman', 'Carl Beverly', 'Michael Dinner', 'Graham Yost', 'Elmore Leonard'], 'Studio': ['FX Cable Channel']} After finally taking advantage of my Amazon Prime membership's video feature the first show I began watching was "Justified' after hearing people (most notable Robin Quivers) say how good it is. I have to agree- it's well acted, written and directed. My favorite actor on the show after Timothy Olyphant is Erica Tazel. Enjoying discovering 'Justified'! {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Chappelle', 'Ernest R. Dickerson', 'Clark Johnson', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Steve Shill', 'Daniel Attias', 'Timothy Van Patten', 'Agnieszka Holland', 'Brad Anderson', 'Clement Virgo'], 'Producers': ['David Simon', 'Robert F. Colesberry', 'Nina Kostroff Noble'], 'Starring': ['Dominic West', 'Sonja Sohn', 'Lance Reddick'], 'Studio': ['HBO Max']} Season 2 was a great successor to the 1st season- plenty of intrigue, crime, kingpins rising and falling. "The Wire" was an underrated gem! Flat out great! {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Producers': ['Rudd Simmons', 'Terence Winter', 'Martin Scorsese', 'Tim Van Patten', 'Stephen Levinson', 'Mark Wahlberg'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Steve Buscemi is great in this series about Atlantic City, bootlegging and the rise of some of the most famous gangsters in American history. Nearly perfect {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alan Ball', 'Daniel Attias', 'Rodrigo García', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Kathy Bates', 'Michael Cuesta', 'Michael Engler', 'Alan Poul', 'Daniel Minahan', 'Miguel Arteta'], 'Producers': ['Alan Ball', 'Robert Greenblatt', 'David Janollari', 'Alan Poul', 'Bruce Eric Kaplan', 'Rick Cleveland', 'Bob Del Valle', 'Lori Jo Nemhauser', 'Craig Wright'], 'Starring': ['Peter Krause', 'Michael C. Hall', 'Frances Conroy'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} A great show that was ahead of its time. Great cast, writing and directing {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Alex Zakrzewski', 'Ernest R. Dickerson', 'Patrick Cady', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Adam Davidson', 'Daisy von Scherler Mayer', 'Tim Hunter', 'Christine Moore', 'Zetna Fuentes'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Mikkel Bondesen', 'Pieter Jan Brugge', 'Jan David Frouman'], 'Starring': ['Titus Welliver', 'Jamie Hector', 'Amy Aquino'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Well written and directed, 'Bosch' is a taut and well paced series with a very good cast.

I look forward to seeing a second season. 'Bosch' is very good with a stellar cast {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kenneth Branagh'], 'Producers': ['David Ellison', 'Dana Goldberg', 'Paul Schwake', 'Mace Neufeld', 'Lorenzo Di Bonaventura', 'David Barron', 'Mark Vahradian'], 'Starring': ['Chris Pine', 'Kevin Costner', 'Kenneth Branagh']} Hmmm... Chris Pine simply doesn't have the presence that I expect from this role and Keiera Knightly was simply annoying and distracting as his love interest.

Mr. Branaugh had directed other action films with similar underwhelming results (the first 'Thor' movie nearly put me to sleep)... This was a decently entertaining movie but not overly satisfying.

IF there is a sequel diminishing Ms. Knightly's character and more emphasis on the action involving Mr Ryan would be my advice. Not enough emphasis on the main character, too much on his wife, poorly directed {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Ohh so good! Thumbs up to season 2! Nucky gets in a major jam and his reign at the top is threatened by those who respect and revile him yet you find out why he is no one to underestimate. Season 2- the entertainment value and drama gets kicked up a few levels Archer Comedy, Animation, Action ['Archer is an animated, half-hour comedy that revolves around an international spy agency and its employees. Although their work is daunting, every covert operation and global crisis are occasions for the staff to undermine, sabotage and betray each other for personal gains, pleasures and prosperity. An FX Networks Original Series.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bryan Fordney', 'Mack Williams', 'Matt Thompson', 'Casey Willis', 'Pierre Cerrato', 'Justin Wagner', 'Chi Duong', 'Megan Johnson', 'Chad Hurd', 'Marcus Rosentrater'], 'Producers': ['Fox']} Changing the entire premise of Archer for season 5 was IMHO an unfunny terrible ideal. I found very little to laugh at and a lot of the setups seemed lame and stretched out way too long. Why?
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preferences:** The user maintains a clear preference for action and drama genres, with an ongoing appreciation for character complexity and development. However, their recent interaction with a comedic animated series indicates an openness to diverse genres, particularly when narrative execution is compromised.

- **Entertainment Quality:** The user continues to assign high ratings but demonstrates a critical approach when the quality does not meet their expectations. A recent average rating of 3.0 suggests disappointment with the series' direction, reflecting their demand for engaging and entertaining content.

- **Rating Standards:** Their critical evaluation is evident in their feedback, where they express dissatisfaction with changes in storytelling that detract from humor. This reinforces their belief in the importance of consistent narrative quality, even in lighter genres.

- **Engagement Style:** The user's review style remains analytical, focusing on how shifts in premise and execution affect their overall enjoyment. Their ability to articulate specific issues with pacing and humor showcases their discerning taste.

- **Interest in Star Power:** While the user values strong performances, their latest interaction reinforces the notion that effective storytelling is essential, regardless of the cast. They expect consistency in quality across various genres.

Overall, the user showcases a sophisticated taste that balances appreciation for compelling narratives with a critical outlook on execution, underscoring their evolving engagement with diverse storytelling.
